column4: I am trying to configure my 11.04 32bit OS to function with my Garmin Oregon GPSr. I am getting this Error Message from Gebbabel: [ERROR] XSERIAL: Cannot open serial port '/media/GARMIN/Garmin/gpx/geocaches.GPX': No such file or directory
[ERROR] Cannot open serial port '/media/GARMIN/Garmin/gpx/geocaches.GPX'
GARMIN:Can't init /media/GARMIN/Garmin/gpx/geocaches.GPX
how do you try to access it?
idk about oregon, older like vista hcx etc need to unload "garmin" kernel-module and being accessed through "USB:"
if you mounted the oregon, can't you just use nautilus to access the files
does "gpsbabel -w -i garmin -f usb: -o gpx -F geocaches.gpx" work on cli?
umount it, "sudo modprobe -r garmin" and try again
gpsbabel does not work with mounted devices, it uses direct access (it did at least with older garmin-gpsr)
: I get: FATAL: Module garmin not found.
"sudo modprobe -r garmin_gps"
: Just to confirm - after sudo modprobe -r garmin_gps I plug the gps back to system ?
yes, and don't mount it
then umount it
: done
any erros from gpsbabel?
Yes: Found no Garmin USB devices.
try it as root, using sudo gpsbabel ... pls
: and no change when running gpsbabel with sudo same error message
things seem to have changed with Oregons. sry no more ideas then. that worked since years for me with my old vistaHCX and some other devices.
Thanx for the help anyway!!!
check http://rfc1149.de/index.php#2010-10-31   and try again
good luck and happy caching:)
